title: PhD Student & Research Assistant
description: Conducting doctoral research in urban policy and spatial analysis. Teaching assistant for undergraduate courses in economics and public policy. Leading research projects on housing policy impacts and demographic modeling.

projects.title: Housing Policy Impacts on School Resource Allocation in California
projects.description: Analyzing causal links between local housing policies (zoning, affordability mandates) and K-12 school funding disparities using econometric models and spatial analysis.

projects.title: Modeling Demographic Futures & Municipal Services in the Sun Belt
projects.description: Developing agent-based models informed by census data and sociological theory to simulate population shifts and predict strain on municipal resources (schools, infrastructure) under different policy scenarios.

title: Senior Data Scientist, Education Funding Equity Initiative
description: Analyzed state and local school funding policies using econometric methods. Developed spatial analysis tools for measuring educational opportunity gaps. Authored policy reports on student segregation and resource inequity.

projects.title: Crossing the Line: Segregation and Resource Inequality Between America's School Districts
projects.description: Highlighting the most racially and economically segregating school district boundaries and measuring their funding inequity using spatial and econometric analysis.

projects.title: Segregation Between America's School Districts in the Twenty-First Century: Mapping Where Students of Different Races Live and Learn Today
projects.description: Analyzing how demographic changes in the 21st century have shifted patterns of racial segregation.

projects.title: ECHO Data Dashboard
projects.description: Education and Housing policy advocates often use data available in different geographic units. This dashboard reestimates ACS, Demographic, School Finance, Environmental and Public Health data at several at all levels to facilitate cross-sector collaboration and advocacy.

title: Research Assistant, Office of the Executive Director for Canada
description: Led comparative analysis of US-Mexico border tax policies and education funding. Coordinated binational research team. Presented findings at international conferences and policy forums.

projects.title: Gender and Diversity Action Plan
projects.description: Helped develop the Bank's first institutionalized gender and diversity guidelines and initiatives.

title: An Agent-Based Framework for Simulating Urban Growth and Resource Equity
publisher: Proceedings of the Computational Social Science Conference

title: Presented: From Art to Enforcement: Amplifying your Fair Housing Message
Border Tax Structures & Education Funding: US-Mexico Comparative Analysis
institution: Collaboration with El Colegio de México
description: Comparative analysis of municipal and state/federal tax policies in US and Mexican border cities and their differential impacts on public school funding.

title: Examaning the impact of racial and economic segregation on school funding
ED Fund Research Cohort
Computational Approaches to Measuring Spatial Inequity
publisher: Annals of the American Association of Geographers

title: Crossing the Line: Segregation and Resource Inequality America's Schools
The Hidden Geography of Educational Inequality
description: An exploration of how municipal boundaries and local governance structures create invisible barriers to educational equity, drawing on research from California's Bay Area school districts.

title: Why Your ZIP Code Still Determines Your Child's Education
description: A data-driven analysis of how residential segregation and local tax policies continue to shape educational opportunities across American communities.

title: The Future of Fair Housing: A Computational Approach
description: How machine learning and spatial analysis can help identify and address housing discrimination patterns in real-time.

title: Nevada Asked A.I. Which Students Need Help. The Answer Caused an Outcry.
description: Interview discussing my article outlining Nevada’s use of AI tools to help identify and support at-risk students.
context: Quoted in a New York Times article, along with a link to my article.

title: The Data Behind Educational Equity
description: Television segment on using computational methods to measure and address educational inequities.
context: Provided expert commentary on the role of data science in education policy research.

title: Young Researchers Tackle Housing and Education Policy
description: Profile piece highlighting doctoral research on the intersection of housing policy and educational outcomes.
context: Featured in university spotlight on graduate student research making policy impact.
